row.title: In the Clouds
row.collector: Robert S. and Grayce B. Kerr Foundation
row.description: Big horn sheep standing in a pack on a steep mountain side. The sheep are all looking over to the viewers right. There are clouds in the background.
row.creditLine: JKM Collection, National Museum of Wildlife Art

row.title: Antelope
row.materials: Oil on Canvas with painted metal frame
row.description: Antelope skull on desert floor. Ground view point. Frame painted as part of image.
row.creditLine: This purchase made possible by previous donations from Sandy Scott and the Widener Charitable Limited Partnership, with additional assistance from Adrienne and John Mars, Anne and John Marion, Ann and Richard Oâ€™Leary, Chuck D. Miller, Peggy and Lowry Mays

row.title: Reaching Jaguar
row.description: IO and hard file reviewed - 11-2008. Jaguar climbing down rock outcropping. Based on studies of Senor Lopez, a jaguar from Paraguay that was the first feline occupant of the Lion House at the Bronx Zoo.
row.creditLine: JKM Collection, National Museum of Wildlife Art
row.owner: Robert S. and Grayce B. Kerr Foundation
